IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE CONTINUING CARE TO RESIDENTS OF SOUTHMINSTER, INC.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SOUTHMINSTER IS A NON-PROFIT, CHARITABLE COMMUNITY THAT EMBRACES THE INDIVIDUAL, FOSTERING A QUALITY OF LIFE CHARACTERIZED BY CHOICE, INDEPENDENCE, WELL-BEING, SPIRITUALITY, DIGNITY, PRIVACY AND PEACE OF MIND FOR EACH PERSON.
IRS990.Desc: CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITYPROVIDE A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES (INDEPENDENT LIVING, ASSISTED LIVING, NURSING) TO OLDER ADULTS THAT ALLOWS THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND AS ACTIVELY AS THEIR FACULTIES AND STRENGTH PERMIT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CORPORATION HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). THE CORPORATION IS CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLIC CHARITY UNDER SECTION 509A(2) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE CORPORATION FILES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. THE CORPORATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY ACTIVITIES THAT WOULD JEOPARDIZE ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. THE CORPORATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY ACTIVITIES THAT ARE SUBJECT TO TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME OR EXCISE OR OTHER TAXES. THE CORPORATION ADOPTED GUIDANCE IN THE INCOME TAX STANDARD REGARDING RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE IMPLEMENTATION HAS HAD NO IMPACT ON THE CORPORATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING THE YEAR, THE ORGANIZATION PAID PATTON MCDOWELL & ASSOCIATES TO HELP RAISE FUNDS FOR A CAPITAL CAMPAIGN. IN ADDITION TO $4,500 IN CASH, THE WORK PERFORMED ALSO SECURED $610,000 IN PLEDGES AND $25,000 IN SPECIFIC BEQUESTS.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: DONATED RICKSHAWS TO BE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC USE FOR DISABLED/ELDERLY THROUGH CYCLING WITHOUT AGE PROGRAM.
TO SUPPORT SENIOR PROGRAMMING AND SUPPORT SERVICES IN THE GREATER CHARLOTTE COMMUNITY
TO PROMOTE RESEARCH FOR THE CURE OF ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE
DANCE FOR PD, EDUCATIONAL SYMPOSIUM, AND AWARENESS LUNCHEON
SEED MONEY FOR CHARLOTTE VILLAGE NETWORK CHAPTER

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DIRECTOR OF PHILANTHROPY WORKS WITH A COMMITTEE OF THE SOUTHMINSTER BOARD TO DETERMINE AREAS OF NEED IN THE OUTSIDE COMMUNITY THAT ALIGN WITH SOUTHMINSTER'S MISSION. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUAL RESIDENTS ARE APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL RESIDENT ACCOUNTS TO ASSIST THEM WITH ENTRANCE FEES AND MONTHLY FEES. GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE RESIDENT.
DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2017, DAVID LACY CONTRIBUTED $18,000 AND KENDA LAUGHEY CONTRIBUTED $14,900 TO A SECTION 457 SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: ADVANCE REFUND $61,515,000 OF SERIES 2007A OUTSTANDING BONDS
CONSTRUCTION OF REPLACEMENT HEALTH CTR. AND 2 INDEPENDENT LIVING BUILDINGS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE NOMINATED BY A NOMINATING COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD, BUT SUCH NOMINEES ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE GOVERNING BODIES OF THE ORGANIZATION'S TWO FOUNDING CHURCHES PRIOR TO ELECTION BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE FINAL FORM 990 WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO BEING FILED. ANY COMMENTS OR QUESTIONS WILL BE DIRECTED TO MANAGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTORS OF THE BOARD SIGN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY/DECLARATIONS EACH YEAR. IF THERE IS A CONCERN THAT A TRANSACTION MAY RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, IT IS PROACTIVELY RAISED WITH THE BOARD FOR DISCUSSION/APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF SOUTHMINSTER, INC. AS PART OF A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF THE PRESIDENT'S PERFORMANCE AGAINST AGREED-UPON GOALS. CHANGES TO COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT ARE RECOMMENDED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO THE BOARD AND ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD. COMPENSATION OF KEY EMPLOYEES OTHER THAN THE PRESIDENT IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT. COMPETITIVE COMPENSATION INFORMATION IS OBTAINED FROM INDEPENDENT SOURCES, SUCH AS GUIDESTAR, TO ENSURE THAT COMPENSATION IS REASONABLE IN RELATION TO THE MARKETPLACE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH ELECTRONIC MUNICIPAL MARKET ACCESS, A SOURCE FOR MUNICIPAL DISCLOSURES AND MARKET DATA. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THIS PROCESS HAS REMAINED UNCHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
